skill.name: skill-lookup
skill.description: Activates when the user asks about Agent Skills, wants to find reusable AI capabilities, needs to install skills, or mentions skills for Claude. Use for discovering, retrieving, and installing skills.
skill.summary: Search, retrieve, and install Agent Skills for Claude and other AI models
skill.author: f

security_audit.summary: The static scanner detected 16 potential 'shell backtick execution' issues and 2 'weak cryptographic algorithm' warnings. All findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The backticks are Markdown code syntax for displaying MCP API function calls (search_skills, get_skill), not shell commands. This is a documentation file explaining how to use the prompts.chat MCP server. No actual code execution occurs.

critical_findings.title: False Positive Backtick Detection
critical_findings.description: Static scanner flagged 16 instances of 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' as potential security issues. These are markdown code examples showing MCP API commands (search_skills, get_skill). Backticks are used in Markdown to denote code syntax, not shell execution. This is standard documentation practice and poses no security risk.
critical_findings.confidence_reasoning: The skill is a documentation file explaining MCP API usage. All backticks appear in markdown code blocks showing API function calls (search_skills, get_skill). No shell execution occurs.

low_findings.title: Markdown Code Examples
low_findings.description: The file contains markdown code examples with backtick syntax. While the static scanner flagged this as potential shell execution, it is standard Markdown formatting for code snippets. No executable code exists.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Confirmed: These are code examples in markdown format, showing MCP API commands like search_skills and get_skill. Standard documentation practice.

content.user_title: Find and Install AI Skills for Claude
content.value_statement: Search and install AI skills to extend Claude's capabilities. This skill provides access to the prompts.chat skill marketplace, allowing you to discover reusable AI agent components and add them to your workflow.
actual_capabilities: Search skills by keyword, category, or tag
Retrieve complete skill metadata and file contents
Install skills to the local .claude/skills directory
List available skills with descriptions and file counts
Filter results by category (coding, automation, etc.)
Access skills compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
limitations: Only searches skills available on the prompts.chat marketplace
Requires internet connection to access the MCP server
Installation requires write access to the .claude/skills directory
Cannot modify or update existing skills once installed
Skill availability depends on the marketplace server status

use_cases.title: Developer discovering new tools
use_cases.description: A software developer wants to find a skill for code review, testing, or deployment automation and needs to browse available skills before installation.

use_cases.title: Team onboarding and sharing
use_cases.description: A team lead shares a collection of recommended skills with new team members, using this skill to retrieve and install them efficiently.

use_cases.title: Experimenting with AI workflows
use_cases.description: A developer testing AI agents wants to quickly install multiple skills to evaluate their effectiveness in different workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner: I need a code review skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I need a code review skill for my projects. Search for skills that help with code reviews and show me the available options with their descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Intermediate: Find testing skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Find skills related to testing and quality assurance. Filter results by the 'coding' category and show me the top 5 skills with their file lists.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced: Install a specific skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the 'git-hook' skill to my .claude/skills directory. Retrieve all files from the skill and confirm the installation was successful.

prompt_templates.title: Expert: Search with multiple filters
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for skills that are both in the 'automation' category and tagged with 'workflow'. Show me results with author names and include a link to each skill.

output_examples.input: I need a skill to help me write better documentation for my API.
output_examples.output:
I found 3 relevant skills:

1. **API Documentation Helper** by john-smith
   - Description: Assists in writing clear API documentation with examples
   - Files: SKILL.md, examples.json
   - Category: documentation
   - Link: prompts.chat/skills/api-doc-helper

2. **Tech Writer Pro** by sarah-dev
   - Description: Templates and guidelines for technical documentation
   - Files: SKILL.md, guidelines.md, templates/
   - Category: documentation
   - Link: prompts.chat/skills/tech-writer-pro

3. **Code Commenter** by mcp-authors
   - Description: Automatically generates comments for code blocks
   - Files: SKILL.md, lib/comments.py
   - Category: coding
   - Link: prompts.chat/skills/code-commenter

Would you like me to install any of these skills?

output_examples.input: Install the 'style-guide' skill for consistent code formatting.
output_examples.output:
Installing 'style-guide' skill...

Retrieved files:
- SKILL.md (main instructions)
- rules.yaml (formatting rules)
- scripts/format.sh (formatting script)

Saved to .claude/skills/style-guide/

âœ“ Installation complete. The style-guide skill is now available and will activate when you need consistent code formatting.

best_practices: Always search for existing skills before creating your own to avoid duplicates
Review skill descriptions and file lists before installing to ensure they meet your needs
Install skills only from trusted sources on the prompts.chat marketplace
Check skill compatibility with your AI tool (Claude, Codex, or Claude Code) before installation
Regularly update installed skills to get the latest features and bug fixes
anti_patterns: Never create duplicate skills for the same functionality
Avoid installing skills that modify system files outside the .claude directory
Do not ignore search results and proceed with creating custom skills unnecessarily
Don't install skills that require elevated privileges or modify global configuration
Avoid using skills that perform operations on files you don't have permission to access

faq.question: What is an Agent Skill?
faq.answer: An Agent Skill is a reusable AI capability that extends Claude's abilities. Skills can perform specific tasks like code review, documentation writing, testing, and more. They are stored as markdown files and can be installed to provide specialized functionality.

faq.question: Where are skills installed?
faq.answer: Skills are installed to the .claude/skills directory in your project root. Each skill gets its own subdirectory containing its files (SKILL.md, scripts, configuration, etc.).

faq.question: Can I modify installed skills?
faq.answer: Skills are read-only once installed. If you need changes, you would need to modify the original skill on the marketplace or create your own custom skill based on the template.

faq.question: What tools support skills?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. You can search and install skills compatible with any of these AI assistants.

faq.question: Are all skills free to use?
faq.answer: Most skills on the prompts.chat marketplace are free and open source. Some creators may offer premium skills with additional features or support.

faq.question: How do I uninstall a skill?
faq.answer: To uninstall a skill, simply delete the corresponding directory from .claude/skills. The skill will no longer be available unless you reinstall it from the marketplace.
